message.entry: Parameter ''{0}'' in ''{1}'' must be a scalar

Output an identity matrix, similar to the functionality of the MATLAB function eye.\n- For scalar matrices, the output is an N-by-N square (symmetric) identity matrix with the number of rows and columns equal to N.\n- For two-element vector output dimensions [M N], the output is an M-by-N (asymmetric) matrix with the number of rows equal to M, the number of columns equal to N, ones down the diagonal, and zeros elsewhere.

Output a constant matrix of specified dimension containing specified element value.\n- For scalar output dimension entry, the output is an unoriented vector.\n- For two-element vector output dimension entry [M N], the output is an M-by-N matrix with the number of rows equal to M and the number of columns equal to N.
Input for block ''{0}'' must be 2-dimensional or scalar.
Compute the determinant of an N*N matrix.
Determine if the input is a symmetric matrix or a skew-symmetric matrix.

entry.note: Specify mode to be upper triangular or lower triangular matrix

message.entry: Determine whether the input is an upper triangular matrix or a lower triangular matrix.
Determine whether the input is an identity matrix.
Determine if the input is a Hermitian matrix or a Skew-Hermitian matrix.

entry.note: Specify mode to be Hermitian matrix or Skew-Hermitian matrix

message.entry: Port input must be a signed data type.
